Example 2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

Grammar: ind, adv, abl sg of ābādha
Meaning IN CONTEXT: as disease; as sickness; as illness; as affliction
Example1: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
ahaṃ kho pubbe ābādhiko ahosiṃ dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca me nacchādesi, na ca me āsi kāye balamattā
Example 2: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?

Example1: ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, yen'ayyo ānando ten'upasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena ayyassa ānandassa pāde sirasā vanda, itthannāmā, bhante, bhikkhunī ābādhikinī dukkhitā bāḷhagilānā.

Grammar: pp of na bahulīkaroti, comp vb
Meaning IN CONTEXT: not practised often; not fully developed; not cultivated; not increased
Example1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti
Example 2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno mettācetovimutti abhāvitā abahulīkatā so suppadhaṃsiyo hoti amanussehi.

Example1: so vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ime pañca āvaraṇe nīvaraṇe cetaso ajjhāruhe paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe appahāya, abalāya paññāya dubbalāya att'atthaṃ vā ñassati
Example 2:
jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

Example1: so vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ime pañca āvaraṇe nīvaraṇe cetaso ajjhāruhe paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe appahāya, abalāya paññāya dubbalāya att'atthaṃ vā ñassati
Example 2:
jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

Example1: nivatth'avatthen'eva gehato nikkhamitvā paramasallekhavuttiko'pi abalabalo amandamando viya paresaṃ acittakarūpena hīḷitaparibhūto hutvā gāmanigamarājadhānīsu ekarattivāsen'eva vicarati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: governing rule which affects those that follow
Example1:
adhikāre maṅgale c'eva, nipphanne c'āvadhāraṇe,
anantare c'apādāne, athasaddo pavattati.
kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, bahalapattapalāso sandacchāyo kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko, seyyathā'pi nigrodho'ti.
Example 2: khandhabījaṃ nāma, assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: freedom from oppressive pain; relief from suffering
Construction: na > a + vi + ā > byā + √bādh + ya
Example 2: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya, abyāpajjhaparamatāya
